suncertify.rmi
Class ContractorManagerConnector

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.rmi.ContractorManagerConnector

public final class ContractorManagerConnector
extends java.lang.Object

Client-side utility class providing static methods for either a network or standalone client to access the contractor manager (local or remote) which, in the role of the model in the MVC, implements the business services interface.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Lars Kuettner
See Also:
ServerUtilities, ContractorManagerRemoteImpl

Method Summary
static ContractorManager getLocal(java.lang.String databaseLocation)
          Factory method to get a new instance of the contractor manager (implementing BusinessServices) for the standalone client.
static ContractorManagerRemote getRemote(java.lang.String hostname, java.lang.String port)
          Factory method to get a ContractorManagerRemote stub and with it an implementation of the BusinessServices interface.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

getLocal

public static ContractorManager getLocal(java.lang.String databaseLocation)
                                  throws ServicesException
Factory method to get a new instance of the contractor manager (implementing BusinessServices) for the standalone client.

Parameters:
databaseLocation - a string representing the path name to the database file
Returns:
the new instance of the contractor manager
Throws:
ServicesException - if the Singleton instance of the data access class could not be obtained

getRemote

public static ContractorManagerRemote getRemote(java.lang.String hostname,
                                                java.lang.String port)
                                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Factory method to get a ContractorManagerRemote stub and with it an implementation of the BusinessServices interface. Called by network client in remote setting.

Parameters:
hostname - a string representing the host name or IP address of the server
port - the RMI port number in string representation
Returns:
the looked-up contractor manager remote object
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if the lookup failed because of a malformed URL or because the RMI service has not been bound to the given hostname and port
